Skin Examination.purpose: Assess for erythema and edema of existing skin lesions

content.content: Erythematous, swollen plaques observed on forearms and dorsal surfaces of hands; tenderness noted.

content.altText: Erythematous skin lesions consistent with leprosy.
content.caption: Inflamed skin lesions

Skin Examination.interpretation: Erythematous patches are consistent with Type 1 reaction in leprosy.

Palpation of Peripheral Nerves.purpose: Evaluate for ulnar nerve tenderness and thickening

findings.content: Right ulnar nerve palpation reveals tenderness and thickening, consistent with neuritis.

Palpation of Peripheral Nerves.interpretation: Thickened ulnar nerve indicative of neuritis in leprosy reaction.

Muscle Strength Testing of Hand.purpose: Assess grip strength and motor function

findings.content: Weak grip strength observed in right hand; patient unable to hold a small object effectively.

Muscle Strength Testing of Hand.interpretation: Weakness correlates with known ulnar nerve involvement.

Reflexes.purpose: Test for ulnar nerve distribution reflexes

findings.content: Reduced reflexes in right hand; normal reflexes observed on left.

Reflexes.interpretation: Reflex findings consistent with impaired ulnar nerve function.

Sensory Examination.purpose: Assess sensory function over ulnar distribution

findings.content: Decreased pinprick sensation over the ulnar distribution in right hand; temperature sensation preserved.

Sensory Examination.interpretation: Sensory deficits align with ulnar nerve involvement.

Eye and Facial Exam.purpose: Evaluate for any cranial nerve involvement

findings.content: Eye exam unremarkable; no signs of facial nerve involvement.

Eye and Facial Exam.interpretation: No cranial nerve involvement detected, consistent with findings.

content.content: Low bacterial index indicates borderline tuberculoid leprosy.

content.altText: Slit-skin smear showing low bacterial index.
content.caption: Slit-skin smear result

Slit-Skin Smear.interpretation: Findings confirm expected results for borderline tuberculoid lepra.

content.content: Microscopic examination shows granulomatous inflammation, perivascular lymphocytic infiltration, and dermal edema.

Complete Blood Count.purpose: Baseline for infection or leukocytosis monitoring
Complete Blood Count.interpretation: CBC results are within normal limits.

Liver Function Tests.purpose: Monitor hepatic safety before starting steroids
Liver Function Tests.interpretation: LFT results indicate normal hepatic function.

Renal Function Tests.purpose: Rule out renal compromise before medications
Renal Function Tests.interpretation: RFT results are within normal limits.

Fasting Glucose.purpose: Assess blood glucose in preparation for steroids

results.content: Fasting glucose level is 90 mg/dL; normal range.

Fasting Glucose.interpretation: Normal glucose level supports safe steroid use.

Nerve Conduction Study.purpose: Evaluate for acute neuritis if symptoms persist

results.content: Reduced conduction velocity suggests acute neuritis in the right ulnar nerve.

Nerve Conduction Study.interpretation: Results confirm clinical suspicion of ulnar nerve damage.

results.content: ESR elevated at 30 mm/hr; indicates active inflammation.

ESR.interpretation: Elevated ESR supports diagnosis of Type 1 reaction.

CRP.purpose: Optional test to assess inflammatory response
CRP.interpretation: Normal CRP; less likely to indicate significant ongoing inflammation.

HIV Test.purpose: Baseline testing for all leprosy cases
HIV Test.interpretation: Negative HIV test indicates no co-infection.
